DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether insulin administered by a subcutaneous injection is effective in the treatment of a diabetic crisis and to determine if beta-hydroxybutyrate is useful to monitor during treatment of a diabetic crisis.
DOC.brief_title: Subcutaneous Aspart Insulin to Treat Diabetic Ketoacidosis (DKA) and Beta-Hydroxybutyrate Testing in DKA
DOC.mesh_term: Insulin degludec, insulin aspart drug combination
DOC.criteria: age 18 or older venous pH < 7.3 or arterial < 7.35 at least 2 of the following 3: 1. serum HCO3 < 18/anion gap > 16 2. serum glucose > 300 mg/dl 3. serum acetone positive pregnant less than age 18
